p: L. heteromorpha is botanically described with the accepted name Sphacele conferta Benth and with the synonym Sphacele heteromorpha Briq. [ 13]. It is a shrub native of the Andean region, growing wild between 2000 and 3000 m above the sea level. The species is distributed in Ecuador, where it has been found in the provinces of Azuay, Cañar and Loja [ 14]. To the best of the authors’ knowledge, no chemical or bio-activity studies about this plant have been reported in literature until now.
